intro: Senecio scabriusculus, commonly known as the roughleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture. Senecio scabriusculus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
